meanings.definition: Capable of being conceived or considered
meanings.sent1: The idea of a flying car is thinkable.
meanings.sent2: It is thinkable to imagine a world without borders.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite thinkable to have a pet elephant in a tiny apartment.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a mermaid is as thinkable as growing wings.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time travel is so thinkable that it captures the imagination.

meanings.definition: Within the realm of possibility or imagination
meanings.sent1: Winning the lottery is a thinkable outcome.
meanings.sent2: It is thinkable that aliens exist in the vast universe.
meanings.sent3: It's thinkable that pigs might fly one day.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a world without war seems as thinkable as a utopia.
meanings.sent5: The thought of teleportation is so thinkable in science fiction.
